message_1: In a group of 40 students, 20 studied French, 22 studied Spanish, and 15 studied both French and Spanish. How many students in the group studied at least one of these languages?
message_2:
To find the number of students who studied at least one of these languages, we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion.

Number of students who studied at least one language = (Number of students who studied French) + (Number of students who studied Spanish) - (Number of students who studied both French and Spanish)

= 20 (French) + 22 (Spanish) - 15 (Both)

= 42 - 15

= 27

So, 27 students in the group studied at least one of these languages.
